sections.title: Context & Role in Aegis IAM
sections.goal: Understand the interviewee’s scope of responsibility, day-to-day tasks, and how they interface with UX concerns in IAM.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your role in the Aegis IAM operations and what a typical week looks like?
How do you collaborate with other departments, such as UX or Platform, when it comes to identity and access management?
What are the most critical security policies or runbooks you reference regularly?

sections.title: Security-UX Interplay
sections.goal: Explore how security measures impact user flows and vice versa.
sample_questions: Have you encountered situations where strict security controls conflicted with usability?
How do you evaluate the trade-offs between least privilege and user productivity?
Can you share an example where UX feedback influenced a security configuration?

sections.title: Incident & Runbook Experience
sections.goal: Gather insights about how incidents are handled, especially in relation to RB-IAM-075.
sample_questions: Could you describe a time you had to use the Access Revocation Emergency runbook?
What signals or alerts typically trigger IAM-related incident responses?
How do you ensure that incident handling remains compliant with POL-SEC-001?

sections.title: Integration with Other Systems
sections.goal: Understand dependencies and how IAM interacts with other projects and systems.
sample_questions: What are the main integration points between Aegis IAM and projects like Orion Edge Gateway or Nimbus Observability?
How do you handle authentication/authorization in cross-project scenarios?
Have you identified any recurring friction points in these integrations?

sections.title: Risk Assessment & Future Improvements
sections.goal: Explore how risks are assessed and mitigated, and identify potential UX and security improvements.
sample_questions: What’s your approach to threat modeling in the context of IAM user journeys?
How do you balance quick feature rollouts with the need for rigorous security testing?
If you could change one process or tool in IAM to better serve both security and UX, what would it be?
